content:
Hello @Lisa Nelson and greetings to all Gravity track participants,

I am on NewWave's Gravity Team and we are so excited to play the PMEHR role in this track! Just a couple questions regarding our meetings and how we will collaborate:

  • I understand there is a common introductory call for all Connectathon members at 4PM today - do we have an additional separate Gravity Track call to introduce ourselves as well?
  • Will there be a separate meeting dial-in/link to connect to our track's meetings? We do have access to the overall connectathon link, but we are assuming for the Gravity track there will be separate dial-in information.

Thanks so much, we look forward to hearing back about this and meeting everyone!

  • Michael Cox, NewWave Telecom & Technologies

Below are the details for the Gravity Track:
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+Zoom+Info+for+Each+Track

Date Time & Agenda
May 13: 4 to 4:30 pm HL7 kick-off
May 13: 5 to 5:30 pm Track kick-off

May 14: 9 to 10 am Intro, overview, provide resources
May 14: 10 am to 5:30 pm Track testing

May 15: 9 to 10 am Recap and review Thurs. testing problems and solutions
May 15: 10 am to 12:30 pm Track report-outs
May 15: 1 to 1:30 pm Participate in Care Coordination Track
May 15: 1:30 to 6 pm Participate in Care Coordination Track

The schedule with Plan A and Plan B (depending on the length of the HL7 webinar that starts at 4:00 pm ET) can be found here: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1hFmq2jvEwxLabb0dy3B09dZkwkDirfxH7XpYcR15Qpc/edit?usp=sharing

@Mike C. Great to have you as a PMEHR - we look forward to testing with you! perhaps you could post your oAuth documentation here. That would be helpful for people who are at that level of readiness. @Yan Wang Heads up....NuWave might be able to use our patient tokens....let's explore this once Mike posts his documentation.
